G4765-d-04-28-00-WC.Narrative: WHILE PERFORMIG SWITCHING DUTIES, JOB FY1975 HAD PULLED TRACK 550 THEN CUT OFF OVER SWITCH TO SHOOVECAR ON TRACK 551.  WHILE THE CONDUCTOR WAS WALKING BACK TOWARDS THE HEAD END TO TIE A HAND BRAKE, TRACK 550 HAD ROLLED OUT AND INTO TRACK 551.  STEX 26821 ON TRACK 550 ROLLED OUT AND SIDESWIPED GATX61867 ON TRACK 551. BOTH CARS SUSTAINED DAMAGE BUT WERE NOT DERAILED.  NO TRACK DAMAGED REPORTED.  THE CREW WAS TESTED, ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.  IT WAS FOUND THAT THE CONDUCTOR HAD FAILED TO PROPERLY SECURE HAND BRAKES ON TRACK 550 ALLOWING IT TO ROLL OUT AND INTO THE SIDE OF STANDING TRACK 551.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4763-d-04-20-00-WC.Narrative: WHILE PERFORMING SWITCHING DUTIES, THE 1530 SWITCH CREW HAD CARS ON TRACK 73 ROLL OUT AND INTO THE SIDE OF A STANDING CUT OF CARS ON TRACK 72.  THE CREW HAD GRABBED 8 CARS OFF TRACK, LINED THE SWITCHFOR 73 TRACK AND THEN LET THE CARS DRIFT DOWN THE LEAD INTO 73 TRACK.  THEY FAILED TO CONTROL THE SPEED OF THE 8 CAR CUT AT THE LOCATION OF RELEASE POINT ALLOWING THE CARS ON 73 TRACK TO SHOVE INTO THE STANDING CUT OF CARS ON 72 TRACK.  THE RELEASE POINT SHOULD HAVE BEEN CLOSER TO 73 TRACK THUS PREVENTING THIS INCIDENT FROM OCCURRNG.  TRACK 73 HAD 8 LOADS AND 7 EMPTIES ON IT BEFORE THE CREW ADDEDTHE 8 LOADED CARS.  THE DAMAGE WAS FOUND BY THE MLO AND TRAINMASTER WHEN WALKING THE TRACKS.  THEY FOUND THAT 2 EMPTY TANK CARS WERE TIPPED ON 72 TRACK WHEN THE CARS ON 73 TRACK SHOVED INTO THE SIDE OF THEM.  CAR HPJX 12083 WAS NOT DERAILED BUT DID SUSTAIN DAMAGE IN THE IMPACT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

157974-d-04-16-00-SOO.Narrative: WHILE HUMPING IN THE AUTOMATED MODE, THE DRAWBARS CROSSED BETWEEN THE SP AND THE SOU CARS.  COUPLINGWAS ON STRAIGHT TRACK, APPROXIMATELY 13 CAR LENGTHS FROM WEST END.  SUBSEQUENTLY, HEAVY LOADS OF GRAIN IN 3 CAR CUTS WERE ALSO HUMPED INTO 25 TRACK.  THE SPEEDS THRU THE GROUP RETARDERS WERE AT THE REQUESTED 6 MPH.  EACH ADDITIONAL COUPLING AND IMPACT FORCED THE CROSSED DRAWBAR ON THE SP CAR TO OVERRIDE AND PUNCTURE THE END DOOR OF THE SOU AUTO RACK.  THE RAIL WAS ALSO TIPPED FOR APPROXIMATELY 100 FEET AS A RESULT OF THE LATERAL PRESSURE.  THIS DAMAGE WAS DISCOVERED AT 1230 ON 4/17 AS THE 0700TOP END JOB WAS GETTING THE TRACK TOGETHER TO ROLL FOR AN OUTBOUND TRAIN.  CAUSE KNUCKLES BYPASSED ON TANGENT TRACK.  CARS DEPARTED PROYARD SYSTEM AT REQUESTED SPEED.  NO OTHER CONDITIONS WERE FOUND TO CAUSE DERAILMENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
